content: Morning Fog Brings Relief For California Fire Crews SANTA BARBARA, Calif. — Authorities in California's Santa Barbara County say a dramatic change in weather means most evacuees from the area of a major wildfire will be allowed to return home. Cheers broke out Saturday as Sheriff Bill Brown announced that mandatory evacuation orders were being downgraded to evacuation warnings for the bulk of the populated areas threatened by the fire since Tuesday. The blaze had burned 80 homes and forced 30,000 people to flee. It had burned across more than 13 square miles. The evacuation orders are being lifted in stages over several hours to avoid traffic jams. The cause of the fire has not yet been determined.
